option.name: title_text
option.value: Changing Passive Voice to Active Voice - Identifying Parts of a Sentence

string_table.name: npxnabnsnfns00001010011
string_table.string: Use the w, a, s, and d keys to move around the 360 degree image. Press the tab key to jump to interactive markers and hotspots.
To preview this video, use the Preview functionality in Storyline, republish your course using standard MP4 video, or publish to Review 360.
Streaming video is unavailable for local playback.

slidelink.displaytext: Grammar Lesson - Active and Passive Tone
Identifying subjects and verbs in a sentence

search.slidetext: changing passive voice to active voice improving your writing skills one part-of-speech at a time! next

lesson overview learning objectives identifying subjects and verbs in a sentence. determining the difference between passive and active voice. creating sentences with active voice. changing sentences from passive voice to active voice. start
identifying subjects and verbs in a sentence. objective 1

object something in the sentence that is being acted on by the subject. verb the action being done in the sentence, usually by the subject. subject the person, place, or thing performing the action. what makes up a sentence? identifying subjects and verbs in a sentence. a sentence is made up of 3 parts: subject verb object
taylor played the piano. let’s identify the different parts of this sentence! identifying subjects and verbs in a sentence.
let’s identify the different parts of this sentence! identifying subjects and verbs in a sentence. taylor played the piano. the subject of the sentence is what performs the action in the sentence.
let’s identify the different parts of this sentence! identifying subjects and verbs in a sentence. taylor played the piano. subject the verb of the sentence is the action being done.
let’s identify the different parts of this sentence! identifying subjects and verbs in a sentence. taylor played the piano. subject verb the object of the sentence is what has the action done to it.
let’s identify the different parts of this sentence! identifying subjects and verbs in a sentence. taylor played the piano. subject verb object

incorrect incorrect. double-check what action is being performed in the sentence to find the verb. try again try again try again try again try again try again continue continue continue continue continue continue incorrect. review the previous slides and double-check what action is being performed in the sentence to find the verb. incorrect continue continue continue continue continue continue that's right! reported is the action, or verb, being performed in the sentence. correct what is the verb of the below sentence: “ i reported the results.” quiz question 1 check for understanding “the results.” “the results.” “the results.” “the results.” “the results.” “the results.” “i” “i” “i” “i” “i” “i” “reported” “reported” “reported” “reported” “reported” “reported” identifying subjects and verbs in a sentence.

incorrect try again. review the slide showing the different parts of speech. try again try again try again try again try again try again incorrect incorrect. try to find the verb first and what is performing the verb. whatever is performing the verb is the subject. continue continue continue continue continue continue correct that's right! simple sentences are structured to help you know what a sentence is trying to say. continue continue continue continue continue continue drag and drop the parts of the sentence that represent what into part it is of speech. review parts of speech on this slide. identifying subjects and verbs in a sentence. quiz question 1 subject verb object the cat the sock. ate

summary the subject of the sentence is what performs the action in the sentence. the verb of the sentence is the action being done. the object of the sentence is what has the action done to it. identifying subjects and verbs in a sentence. taylor played the piano.
time to practice identifying subjects and verbs in a sentence. let’s go!

incorrect try again. find the verb and then see what is performing the action of the verb. that will be the subject. try again try again try again try again try again try again incorrect incorrect. find the verb and then see what is performing the action of the verb. that will be the subject. continue continue continue continue continue continue correct that's right! continue continue continue continue continue continue identify the different parts of the sentence below by dragging them to the part-of-speech they represent! subject verb object sandra bought a camera. beware! there may be some extra words that don’t fit into any of the below buckets.

terms.term: Something in the sentence that is being acted on by the subject.
The person, place, or thing performing the action.
The action being done in the sentence, usually by the subject.
